column4: Do You Need Help from Tameside Adult Social Care and Health (formerly Social Services)?

column1: • How may we be able to help you
• Will we be able to help you?
• Can you contact Social Care and Health direct?
• Who will you talk with when you contact us?
• Is there a charge for the service?
• What if you are in hospital?
• How do you contact Tameside Social Care and Health?
This page explains how Tameside Social Care and Health (formerly Social Services) can help you live as independently as possible.

You must be eighteen or over and live in Tameside. You may have a physical, sensory or learning disability or be an older person. You may be having difficulties with daily living tasks and feel you are losing your independence. You may be a carer and feel you need support looking after the person you care for.
How may we be able to help you
The services we may be able to offer depend on your personal circumstances. There are a wide range of services provided, some of which are:
• Help to manage your personal care in your own home
• Equipment and adaptations to help you live at home
• Support for those with a visual impairment or who are Deaf or hard of hearing
• Information about other services and organisations who may be able to help you
Will we be able to help you?

For us to find out whether we are able to offer you services, we will ask you questions about your situation. We call this a Contact Assessment. Once we have gathered this information we must apply guidelines, called Eligibility Criteria, to see if you are eligible for services from us. The Government has set these eligibility criteria to ensure fair access to care services across the country. All Social Care and Health departments in England and Wales must apply these Criteria to help them to prioritise and make sure resources go to those in greatest need.
If we cannot offer a service, we can give information and advice about other organisations that may be able to help.

If you do meet our criteria for service, we will prioritise your need according to the urgency of the situation. We will work with you on a more detailed assessment and ensure the most appropriate services are put in place.
Can you contact Social Care and Health direct?

Yes. Sometimes your GP, nurse or other health professional may contact us on your behalf with your consent. However, you can contact Social Care and Health yourself if you feel you need help. If you are contacting us on behalf of someone else, you must have their permission.
Who will you talk with when you contact us?

You need to contact the Adult Assessment and Customer Care Team which is part of Social Care and Health. A Customer Care Officer will talk through your difficulties and complete a Contact Assessment with you.
This can be done over the phone or by visiting Stalybridge Resource Centre. Where this is not possible, we may visit you at home.
We also have staff who use a range of languages including British Sign Language.
Is there a charge for the service?

No. We do not charge you anything for the assessment or any information and advice we may give you. However, there may be charges for some of the services we provide. Don't worry, a Social Worker would talk with you about any charges.
The information you give is confidential and we will only share it with those people who need to know about your situation. We will always ask your permission before sharing that information.
What if you are in hospital?
If you are in hospital and are worried about how you will cope when you leave, contact the Hospital Transfer Service - 0161 331 5173 or talk with the ward staff.
How do you contact Tameside Social Care and Health?
If you would like to contact us to see if you are able to receive services, please see our contact information at the bottom of this page.
You may like to fill out an on-line enquiry form.
You may like to make an appointment using our on-line diary.
If you need to contact Social Care and Health outside normal working hours, please telephone 0161 342 2222

Tameside Social Care and Health (formerly Social Services) is committed to providing quality services. We need to hear from you if you have any complaints, suggestions or compliments about the service you receive.
